name: Omelette
notes: For 2 people. Use large, curved frying pan. Finely dice green onion from both white and green ends using a sharp knife to make 2 tbsp. Use serrated knive to dice tomatoes. Use a combination of red, orange, and yellow bell peppers and dice with sharp knife. Avoid ribs. For 1 person, use 3 eggs.

instructions.description: Make sure all veggies are diced and ready to go, see notes. Heat large frying pan on low, melting butter
Add olive oil (not too much) and mix and cover curvy parts of pan
Beat 4 large (or medium) and make them fluffy by twirling them upward to mix with air
Watch for bubbling butter before putting eggs into pan
Add eggs to pan and use a large spatula.
Start sliding eggs with spatula and rotating pan. Keep edges crispy and move uncooked part of eggs around.
Fix any holes by filling them and cook for a minute or so
Add cheddar cheese evenly on top
Turn temperature off if too hot. Don't burn bottom of omelette.
Add salsa all around and spread throughout pan with spoon
Add onions, bell peppers to one half of omelette.
Add tomatos and olives to one half of omelette
Add avocado to one half of the omelette since we will be folding it
Add sour cream to one half of the omelette
Fold omelette from the side which has no veggies in one movement of hand like closing a book.
Cut omelette in half and serve to two people by sliding into plate from pan.
